skill.name: creating-skills
skill.description: Guide for creating Claude Code skills following Anthropic's official best practices. Use when user wants to create a new skill, build a skill, write SKILL.md, or needs skill creation guidelines. Provides structure, naming conventions, description writing, and quality checklist.

skill.author: Bae-ChangHyun

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown guidance for creating Claude Code skills. No executable code, no network calls, no file system access, and no command execution capabilities. Contains only best practices documentation and example code blocks.

content.value_statement: Creating Claude Code skills requires understanding structure, naming conventions, and quality standards. This skill provides Anthropic's official best practices to help you build effective, discoverable skills following established patterns.
actual_capabilities: Provide step-by-step workflow for creating new skills
Define required and optional frontmatter for SKILL.md
Guide proper naming conventions and description formulas
Share quality checklist for validating skill implementation
Explain token budget and file organization principles
limitations: Does not execute code or create files automatically
Does not validate or test existing skills
Requires manual implementation of recommended patterns

use_cases.target_user: Skill developers new to Claude Code
use_cases.title: First Skill Creation
use_cases.description: Learn proper structure and conventions for your first Claude Code skill.

use_cases.title: Skill Optimization
use_cases.description: Refactor existing skills to follow latest best practices and wildcard permissions.

use_cases.title: Team Standards
use_cases.description: Establish consistent skill patterns across your organization's development team.

prompt_templates.title: Create Basic Skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a new Claude Code skill called 'pdf-processor' for extracting text from PDF documents.

prompt_templates.title: Write SKILL.md
prompt_templates.prompt: Write the frontmatter and description for a skill that manages GitHub pull requests.

prompt_templates.title: Review Existing Skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my existing skill at ~/.claude/skills/my-skill/SKILL.md and suggest improvements based on best practices.

prompt_templates.title: Scale Large Skill
prompt_templates.prompt: My SKILL.md is over 400 lines. Help me split it into SKILL.md, references/examples.md, and references/troubleshooting.md.

output_examples.input: Help me create a new skill called 'json-formatter' that formats JSON files.

best_practices: Keep SKILL.md under 500 lines by moving examples to references/
Include trigger phrases in description for better skill discovery
Use Bash(git *) wildcard patterns instead of verbose permission lists
anti_patterns: Avoid wrapper scripts that just call external commands
Do not over-explain concepts Claude already knows
Never include multiple competing workflows in one skill

faq.question: What tools support Claude Code skills?
faq.answer: Claude Code skills work in Claude and Claude Code. They may also work in Codex depending on integration.

faq.question: What is the maximum size for a SKILL.md file?
faq.answer: Keep SKILL.md under 500 lines. Move detailed content to references/ folder for larger documentation.

faq.question: Can I create helper scripts for my skill?
faq.answer: Yes, but only for complex logic or multi-step processing. Avoid simple wrapper scripts.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: This is a read-only documentation skill. It does not access files, execute code, or send network requests.

faq.question: Why does my skill not trigger?
faq.answer: Check that frontmatter includes trigger phrases in description. Use action verbs like create, handle, process.

faq.question: How is this different from MCP servers?
faq.answer: Skills are prompt-based guides for Claude behavior. MCP servers provide external tool integrations.
